reasoning: Pendred syndrome is an autosomal recessive genetic disorder characterized by congenital thyroid goiter and sensorineural hearing loss. Prevalence estimated at 4-10 per million globally (0.4-1 per 100k), using midpoint ~0.7 per 100k. Metric: prevalence (lifelong genetic condition, not acute incidence).
source: Cremers CWRJ et al. (1998). Hearing loss in Pendred syndrome. Arch Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 124(4):421-426
